sentence: Helen of Troy Limited'sHELE first-quarter fiscal 2016 adjusted earnings of $1.00 missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate by 5.7%.
Earnings exclude non-cash share-based compensation and amortization of intangible assets and acquisition-related expenses.
Including these, earnings came in at $1.06.
Results declined 3.8% from the year-ago level due to lower operating income, a greater-than-expected impact from foreign currency and the West Coast port disruption.
Net revenues of $345.3 million, up 10.8% from the year-ago level.
Lower sales in Housewares and beauty segments were offset by sales contribution from healthcare and home environment.

Sales, however, missed the Zacks Consensus Estimate of $347 million by nearly 0.5%.The recently acquired Healthy Directions contributed almost $40 million to sales revenue

Gross margin inflated 320 basis points to 41.5% backed by Helen of Troy's recently added category Nutritional Supplement due to acquisition of healthy directons.
Adjusted operating income went down almost 1% to $38.4 million due to higher selling, general and administrative expense ratio.
During the first quarter, Helen of Troy reorganized and renamed personal care into a global beauty organization.
It also started a new operational segment called Nutritional Supplement from the second quarter of fiscal 2015 after the acquisition of Healthy Directions in September 2014 .
The company now operates through four segments - Housewares, Beauty, Healthcare/Home Environment and Nutritional Supplement.

Housewares: Sales in the Housewares category declined 2.4% to $65.2 million from the year-ago period primarily due to a shift in the timing of customer orders into the fourth quarter of fiscal 2015 and the second quarter of fiscal 2016, as well as inventory adjustments in several key retailers.

Beauty: Sales in this category slipped 4.7% year over year to $97.7 million due to challenging retail environment primarily in the hair care solutions category where competition resulted in lower pricing, promotional discounts and loss of distribution.
Healthcare/Home Environment: This category gained 0.4% year over year to $143.0 million backed by product innovations.
Nutritional Supplement : The company entered the nutritional supplement business in Sep 2014 with the takeover of Healthy Directions, LLC and its subsidiaries for a cash transaction of $195 million.
The buyout attributed $39.4 million to first-quarter revenues.
On Mar 31, 2015, Helen of Troy acquired the Vicks VapoSteam U.S. liquid inhalant business from consumer products giant The Procter & Gamble Co. PG .

As part of the agreement, Helen of Troy also acquired trademarks of Vicks VapoPad scent pads in the U.S. Vicks VapoSteam and Vicks VapoPads which are used in Vicks humidifiers, vaporizers and health care devices.

(Read more: Helen of Troy Acquires Vicks VapoSteam from P&G )

The company maintained the fiscal 2016 outlook.
For the fiscal year, the company expects sales in the range of $1.50 billion to $1.54 billion compared with $1.30 billion in the year-ago period.
Earnings per share are expected in the range of $5.40 to $5.85.
Helen of Troy expects to deliver sustainable organic growth by investing in human resource and innovation program, brand building advertising and improving its market position.
The company is also focused on driving productivity and paying dividends, going ahead.
However, it is apprehensive that product costs will remain high and the retail environment will continue to be difficult.
Helen of Troy currently has a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
A couple of stocks in the cosmetics sector worth considering are Coty In.
COTY and Inter Parfums Inc. IPAR .
While Inter Parfums sports a Zacks Rank #1, Coty carries a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy).
